episode_title: 710 - The One With the Holiday Armadillo

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is on the phone, Rachel and Monica are sitting in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Buh-bye. (Hangs up the phone) I just got us reservations at Michelle’s and tickets to the Musicman to celebrate our first holiday season as a betroughed couple.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Betrothed… (Corrects him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …betrothed couple.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Haaaa… (Puts the skull on the table) … ahhhh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Skull?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, it’s my mom’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, no. It’s not! It’s not my mom. It belonged to mom. Yeah, no, she used to put it out every Christmas to remind us, that even though it’s Christmas, people still die. And, you can put candy in it. (She grabs the skull, pulls out a stick of licorice, and takes a bite.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Licorice?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure! (Takes one) Hey, I just found out, I get Ben for the holidays this year.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh! That’s great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you gonna dress up as Santa?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nope. I mean, I know Susan does every year, but I think I wanna take this year to teach him all about Hanukkah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And maybe I could teach Ben about the Christmas skull and how people die.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You may need to use this year to teach Ben about Phoebe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm.
(Joey comes out of the bathroom reading a newspaper)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. (He exits)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you know he was in there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How long have we been home?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: About a half an hour.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Love ly!

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler gets a cup of coffee and sits down next to Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you know what I was thinking? When we get married, are you gonna change your last name to Bing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bing’s weird.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hey, you guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Guess what! My landlord just called and my apartment is gonna get ready soon, so I guess I’ll be moving out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ahh, Phoebe, I’m gonna miss you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, you will be very sad. All right, well I gotta go tell Rachel the good news.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh! You guys gonna be living together again?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she’s just so much fun with Joey, I just assumed, she’d still be living with him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why do you think she’s having so much fun living with Joey?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No reason, except…she…told…me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? So she said, she didn’t wanna live with me anymore?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No, she didn’t say that. I-I-I think you should talk to Monica now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, don’t worry about it. I’m sure she wants to live with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re sure? You’re absolutely sure?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, no. But, um, I bet she probably does.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Probably? Yeah, I don’t like that word. (Chandler and Monica look surprised) Kind of what ‘probably’ really means. Yeah, uh-huh. Yeah, oh, “Your mom probably won’t kill herself,” y’know? I’m sorry, but I’m not hanging all my hopes of Rachel and I living together on-on “Probably!” Y’know? You gotta take care of yourselves! (She starts to walk out) In this world history teaches us nothing! (Exits)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bing doesn’t seem so weird now, does it?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting behind a red drum set.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Great, you’re home! Guess what Phoebe got me for Christmas! (Starts drumming.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Drums?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! Drums!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, could we get two burritos to go, please? (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry. But not that sorry, ’cause you don’t have to live with it. Um, we have a reservation under the name Chandler Bing.

content.speaker: Maitre d’
content.text: Oh-kay, we’ll have a table for you in about 45 minutes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Forty-five minutes? We have tickets to the Musicman at 8:00.

content.speaker: Maitre d’
content.text: I’m sorry. Christmas is a very busy time, sir.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is this because of the burrito thing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You need to give him money.
content.parenthetical: pulling Chandler away from the Maitre d’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Give him money? It was a joke!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, to get a table! Places like this are always shakin’ you down. Everybody wants to be paid off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right, calm down, O’mally. I’ll slip him some money.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’ve got to be smooth about it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I can be smooth. (Walks back to the Maitre d’, very smoothly) Listen, we’re a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, I’d appreciate it. (Shakes his hand)

content.speaker: Maitre d’
content.text: Of course, sir.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Walks back to Monica)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How did it go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Had the money in the wrong hand. (Shows her his left hand with the money in it)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is whirling Ben around.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wooooooo, hehehe. Hey, ahh, you don’t feel like you’re gonna throw up, do ya?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I do, so let’s… (Ben and Ross sit down on the couch) So, Ben, you uh, you know what holiday is coming up, don’t ya?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Christmas.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep, and you know what other holiday is coming up?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Christmas eve.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, but also (Pauses to let Ben answer, but he doesn’t.) Hanukkah! See, you’re part Jewish, and-and Hanukkah is a Jewish holiday.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Santa has reindeers that can fly!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right, um, but, on Hanukkah, Hanukkah is a celebration of a miracle. See, years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Jingle bells, jingle bells …

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, that’s right, yes, but on Hanukkah, uh, we sing, uh (Sings) Draydl, draydl, draydl, I made you out of clay .

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Rudolph, the red-nosed reindeer …

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it’s not a contest.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: When is Santa coming?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, how about this year, instead of Santa, we have fun celebrating Hanukkah?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: No Santa? Was I bad?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Oh, no-no-no. Hey, you weren’t bad, you’ve been very good, Ben.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Santa’s mad at me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, hey-hey, come on, (He grabs Ben and sits him on his lap) Ben, Santa is not mad at you, okay? Hey, you’re-you’re his favorite little guy!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: So Santa’s coming?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! Santa’s coming!

content.description: [Scene: Michelle’s, Chandler and Monica are discussing how to bribe the Maitre d’.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s easy! Just keep it casual! Give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How do you know so much about this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Richard used to do it, didn’t he?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’d be eating our soup right now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mustached bastard…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, those people just left, come on! Quick! Give him the money and get their table!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me…
content.parenthetical: walks up to the Maitre d’

content.text: [Chandler can’t find his money in the pocket. In the meantime, another couple shows up, and Chandler turns away to look for his money]

content.speaker: Male Guest
content.text: Good evening. (Shakes his hand)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh-hahaha! (Turns around to give the Maitre d’ his money, but he isn’t there anymore)

content.description: The Hallway, Phoebe comes up the stairs and hears drumming coming from Joey and Rachel’s, so she enters smiling and then sees that Rachel, not Joey, is the one playing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ha!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you like the drums! That’s, that’s great! Y’know, I was worried, that, you know, they would maybe an unbearable living situation. All right, okay, well, apparently not! So, yay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, Pheebs, check it out, we already learned a song. (To Rachel) Ready? One, two, three, four…
[Rachel hits some tom-toms and ends up on the ‘crash’-cymbal, which is in fact a ride-cymbal, but whatever…]

content.speaker: Rachel and Joey
content.text: Tequila!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s fun. (She exits disappointedly.)

content.description: Central Perk, Gunther is serving Chandler and Monica coffee.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you Gunther, put it there. (He gets up, and shakes Gunther’s hand. A bunch of coins fall out his hand. He sits down next to Monica.) Definitely not easier with coins. (Joey gets up and picks up the coins. Chandler thinks, Joey is just helping him to pick them up.) Thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you. (He gets up and puts on his jacket.) (Phoebe enters) Hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here. (Gives her the coins) Now I only owe you $49.50.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! (she sits down next to him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If you wanna give Joey a Christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a phial of small pox to release in the hallway?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not just the drum noise. Every five minutes, Joey throws his sticks in the air, and I have to hear, “Oh my eye! Oh god, my eye!” I mean, it is so annoying.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, thank you. You see, this is how normal people are supposed to react to drums.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you got Joey drums to annoy Rachel, so she wouldn’t wanna live there anymore?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe on some level.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sitting behind the drums wearing safety goggles, hitting them with his sticks as Rachel watches.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, y’know that you could just not throw the sticks up in the air.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is Rock ‘n’ Roll about that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Joey, I got you another present. (She puts it on the counter)
content.parenthetical: entering with an aquarium covered by a towel

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh wait, before you tell me what it is! (He plays a drum-roll) Okay, what is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s a…tarantula! (Joey almost falls down from his drum-stool jumping up) Oh! God! Rachel, look, I’m sorry. What was I thinking giving Joey this big, gross, scary spider in such a poorly constructed cage?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you talking about? I love them! (Looks into the cage) Yeah, I had a tarantula when I was a kid. But it-it died, because my cat ate it. And then, then my cat died. But Joey, isn’t this cool?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is it on me? I feel, I feel like it’s on me! I got, hey! (He storms into his room)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, isn’t that adorable? Joey is afraid of the tarantula.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah, yeah, he’s so adorable, God, he’s just so much fun, Joey is the best, I’m glad you’re having so much fun here. (She turns around, about to leave)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Wait-wait a minute, what? Phoebe, what’s the matter?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Our apartment is ready.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And that makes you angry because…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because you would rather live here with Joey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Where did you get that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica and Chandler said that you were having so much fun here. And apparently no amount of drums or tarantulas is gonna change that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hm?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you get all this stuff for Joey to try and drive me out of the apartment? Honey, if you wanted to do that, you might as well just gotten him a fish, you know how fish freaked me out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fish!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It wouldn’t have mattered anyway, Phoebe, you and I are, are gonna live together, we’re roommates; that’s the deal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, but I wanted you to want to live with me, but okay, if you’re having so much fun over here…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s so much more fun with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We did have fun, didn’t we?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We did!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, anyway, they say, if we want, we can see it tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I would love to!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay, okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good, good, good, good, good. (She runs to the drums and gets the sticks)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great, all right, okay, and Monica ask me to make the drumming stop.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um… (She goes to the tarantula-cage and puts the sticks into it) Done!
content.parenthetical: with the sticks in her hands

content.description: [Scene: Halloween Adventure, a costume shop, there is a salesman behind the counter, Ross enters.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Salesman
content.text: Hello, Sir. You’re here to return those pants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, these are my pants.

content.speaker: Salesman
content.text: Oh. Okay! How can I help you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, uh, do you have a Santa-outfit left?

content.speaker: Salesman
content.text: Two days before Christmas? Sorry, man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay look, do-do, you have anything Christmassy? I promised my son, and I really don’t want to disappoint him, um, come on, I…uh, you gotta have something.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica has just opened the door for Ross who is costumed as an Armadillo. Ben is standing next to her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m the holiday armadillo! I’m a friend of Santa’s and he sent me here to wish you (Points to Ben) a Merry Christmas!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What happened to Santa, Holiday Armadillo?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Santa was unavailable so close to Christmas.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, come in, have a seat. You must be exhausted coming all the way from…Texas.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Texas?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, Ben. I’m Santa’s representative for all the southern states. And Mexico! But, Santa sent me here to give you these presents, Ben. (He tries to bend down to pick up the bag with the presents, but can’t because of the costume) Maybe the Lady will help me with these presents.
[Monica picks up the bag, while Ross closes the door and hits Monica with his tail. They walk into the living room, and Monica empties the bag.]

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Wow! Thanks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re welcome, Ben. Merry Christmas, ooh, and Happy Hanukkah!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Are you for Hanukkah, too? Because I’m part-Jewish.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You are? Me, too!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You wanna wander in the hall? (to Ben) Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the Festival of Lights?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Cool!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on Ben.
[Monica and Ben sit down on the couch.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Santa! (Runs to Chandler and hugs him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! (Grunts as Ben hits him at full speed.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing here, Santa?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird…turtle-man?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Did you bring me any presents, Santa?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You bet I did, Ben, put it there! (He shakes Ben’s hand, but the money falls out of his hands) (to Monica) Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren’t so damn small! (Realizes, that Ben is standing right there) Ho, ho, ho!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay Ben, why don’t you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There’s a sentence, I never thought I’d say.
[They walk to the kitchen; everyone is lowering their voices]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you, but, but you gotta leave.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because, I’m finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you’re-you’re wrecking it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I didn’t get to shake my belly like a bowl full of jelly.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, Chandler but this, this is really important to me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine, I’ll give the suit back.
[Ross turns around and walks back to Ben.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, you think, you can keep it another night? (She has a really teasing look on her face and keeps twirling Chandler’s beard.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Santa? Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, is that okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then it’s okay! (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay Ben, Santa has to go. Say good-bye!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: No! Why does he have to go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because, if Santa and the Holiday…Armadillo? (Ross nods) …are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: No! Why can’t the Armadillo leave? I want Santa!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, I-I give up. Santa, Santa can stay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’ll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Okay, Santa!
(Ross mouths to Chandler, “Thank you,” and he mouths, “You’re welcome,” back.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, it’s time for the story of Hanukkah. Years and years ago, there were these people called the Maccabees.
[Joey enters in a Superman-costume]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Merry Christmas!

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, they are entering to check out the newly refurbished apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow! Look at this place!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this is terrible. Oh, they’ve made so many changes I can’t even feel my grandmother’s presence anymore—Ooh! New sconces!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, remember uh, remember how you told me that your grandmother put up that wall to make that into two bedrooms?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And remember how you always said you were afraid the landlord would find out and then tear it down?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you really not know where I’m going with this? (Phoebe nods, “No.”) It left! It’s one huge room!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! (She runs to see.) (Running back, excitedly) Oh! Wow!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I guess we’ll just have to put the wall back up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You can’t, because of the new skylight!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There’s a skylight?! (Runs to see and yells from the bedroom.) Wow!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what should we do? Should we start looking for a new place?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know I’m-I’m sensing that um, my grandmother would not be comfortable with that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah? Startin’ to feel her again there are we?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A little bit, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs is your grandmother maybe saying that you should live here alone?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You heard her too?! You have the gift!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, it’s okay. I like living with Joey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh please, I hate packing, it’s closer to work, and we do have fun. Although, I’m really gonna miss living with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh me too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. (They hug.) Oh-oh, wait did you hear that-hear that? Listen, I’m gettin’ something from your grandmother, she said that since you get to keep the one bedroom apartment you should give Rachel the purple chair?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I do not hear that.

content.description: [Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Santa (Chandler), Superman (Joey), Ben, and Monica are listening to the Holiday Armadillo (Ross) finish telling the story of Hanukkah.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …and the miracle was that that little bit of oil that should’ve just lasted just one day, burned for…

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Eight whole days.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, and that’s why we celebrate Hanukkah today. The end.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Awesome!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt. (Glaring at Joey who’s nodding.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The Armadillo was actually not so thrilled about that part! Okay Ben, it’s time to light the Hanukkah candles! (Santa, Superman , Monica, Ben, and the Holiday Armadillo go over to the menorah to light the candles.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! It looks like the Easter Bunny’s funeral in here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, come on, we’re-we’re-we’re lighting the candles!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.
(They both go over to light the candles.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I understand why Superman is here, but why is there a porcupine at the Easter Bunny’s funeral?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is closing the door on the tarantula cage.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I got it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is it back in the cage?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Its back in cage!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cage closed?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!
(Joey throws open his door and stands there still in the Superman costume then slowly makes his way to the bathroom while keeping both eyes on the cage.)
